docs.title: Debug JSON-RPC API
docs.description: Ten supports a subset of Geth's DEBUG JSON-RPC API. This

docs.title: JSON-RPC API
docs.description: Ten offers compatibility with a subset of Ethereum's JSON-RPC API. This document outlines the supported JSON-RPC API methods.

docs.title: Sensitive APIs
docs.description: Ten supports a subset of Ethereum's JSON-RPC API.

docs.title: Consensus Mechanism
docs.description: Ten combines Ethereum's L1 security, rollup efficiency, Secure Enclave privacy, and the POBI mechanism for a unique consensus approach.

docs.title: Design
docs.description: Ten is architected as an L2 protocol, leveraging the rollup pattern to store transaction data on the L1 chain. While most rollup implementations aim for scalability, Ten's primary objective is confidentiality. The rollups encapsulate the entire encrypted transaction data.

docs.title: Governance
docs.description: Ten's governance is explicit, transparent, and draws inspiration from the experiences of Bitcoin and Ethereum. In a decentralized system, control can be:

docs.title: Interaction with Ethereum
docs.description: Ten serves as a confidential extension to Ethereum, enabling assets to move seamlessly between the two networks. While many sidechains and L2 solutions have developed bridges to address mismatches between different network models, Ten's approach is distinct, ensuring a decentralized and secure interaction.

docs.title: System Components
docs.description: Cryptography

docs.title: Develop & Deploy dApp
docs.description: 1. Develop Smart Contracts

docs.title: Explore Contracts in Ten
docs.description: Ten offers a distinct environment for smart contract development so you'll need to consider how to design your dApps slightly differently from how you would a transparent dApp. This guide explains these differences:

docs.title: Set Up Dev Environment
docs.description: 1. Wallet Setup & Configuration

docs.title: Get Tokens
docs.description: Use Ten Discord Faucet

docs.title: Set up your wallet
docs.description: Ten is fully compatible with Ethereum and seamlessly integrates with MetaMask. If you're unfamiliar with MetaMask or wallets, start here.

docs.title: Running a node
docs.description: Thank you for your interest in running a node on Ten!

docs.title: Migrate your dApp to Ten
docs.description: Migrating to Ten is a straight-forward process that immediately unlocks private state.

docs.title: Features
docs.description: 1. Encryption: Data Confidentiality and Computational Privacy

docs.title: Overview
docs.description: Ten in Web3

docs.title: Technology
docs.description: At the heart of Ten's innovative approach to blockchain encryption lies the pragmatic use of Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs). These TEEs are not just about encryption; they ensure unparalleled confidentiality while providing absolute certainty about the code in execution. This technology empowers Ten to deliver a unique blend of smart contracts, decentralization, scalability, and encryption, setting a new benchmark in the blockchain realm.

docs.title: Fungible Tokens
docs.description: ERC-20 on Ten

docs.title: Random Numbers
docs.description: Using Randomness on Ten

docs.title: Testnet FAQ
docs.description: What is the Ten testnet?

docs.title: DApp Ideas
docs.description: Below are some of the dApps we'd love to see built on Ten. Feel free to reach out on Discord if you'd like to discuss the ideas in more detail or request support.

docs.title: Getting started with testnet for users
docs.description: Galxe

docs.title: Running a node
docs.description: Thank you for your interest in running a node on the Ten testnet.

docs.title: Compatible Tools
docs.description: These are the list of compatible tools & libraries. We are constantly working to improve your developer experience & will support all of them soon.

docs.title: Cross Chain Messaging
docs.description: Ten features a cross-chain messaging protocol, facilitating secure and decentralized communication across layers.

docs.title: Gateway Widget
docs.description: NPM packages for the Ten Gateway Widget will be released soon along with the documentation for integrating.

docs.title: Hosted Gateway
docs.description: The Ten Gateway is a critical application that facilitates communication between a Ten node and various tools that require a connection to it, such as MetaMask. Due to the encryption of data within a Ten node, direct communication is not feasible.

docs.title: Ten Faucet
docs.description: Ten Discord Faucet

docs.title: TenScan
docs.description: Ten Block Explorer

docs.title: Standard Bridge
docs.description: The standard Ten bridge is a trustless and decentralized asset bridge leveraging a wrapped token mint and burn pattern. It's built on the cross-chain messaging protocol and operates entirely as a smart contract, eliminating the need for separate runnables or nodes.

docs.title: FAQs
docs.description: For Developers

docs.title: How to submit a bug reports
docs.description: If you have encountered any bugs in Ten, we invite you to tell us about it, thereby making a contribution to help us evolve!

docs.title: Guessing Game
docs.description: Guessing Game

metadata.title: Welcome
metadata.description: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin.

blogPosts.content:
[Docusaurus blogging features](https://docusaurus.io/docs/blog) are powered by the [blog plugin](https://docusaurus.io/docs/api/plugins/@docusaurus/plugin-content-blog).

Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the `blog` directory.

Regular blog authors can be added to `authors.yml`.

The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as:

- `2019-05-30-welcome.md`
- `2019-05-30-welcome/index.md`

A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images:

![Docusaurus Plushie](./docusaurus-plushie-banner.jpeg)

The blog supports tags as well!

**And if you don't want a blog**: just delete this directory, and use `blog: false` in your Docusaurus config.

metadata.title: MDX Blog Post
metadata.description: Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX.

blogPosts.content:
Blog posts support [Docusaurus Markdown features](https://docusaurus.io/docs/markdown-features), such as [MDX](https://mdxjs.com/).

:::tip

Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts.

```js
<button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button>
```

<button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button>

:::

metadata.title: Long Blog Post
metadata.description: This is the summary of a very long blog post,

blogPosts.content:
This is the summary of a very long blog post,

Use a `<!--` `truncate` `-->` comment to limit blog post size in the list view.

<!--truncate-->
